question.text: Which of these children will always be homozygous for both the blood group alleles and the Rh blood group system?

options.text: O Rh+ve child from O Rh+ve mother and O Rh-ve father
A Rh-ve child from A Rh-ve mother and O Rh-ve father
AB Rh+ve child from A Rh+ve mother and B Rh-ve father
O Rh-ve child from O Rh-ve mother and O Rh-ve father

solution.text:
Rh antigen follows normal Mendelian inheritance. If 'R' is the allele which produces Rhesus antigen and 'r' is the allele which doesn't, then a person with Rh+ve blood group can be RR or Rr while a person with Rh-ve blood group will always be rr (always homozygous). Person with A blood group may have genotype IAIA or IAIO. A person with AB blood group has genotype IAIB. A person with blood group O has genotype IOIO (always homozygous)

If the person is heterozygous for both blood group systems, genotype should be IAIB Rr (AB Rh+ve child)
